title: A Phase 2b, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multiple Dose, Biomarker and Safety Study of PTI-125 in Mild-to-moderate Alzheimer's Disease Patients
description_brief: This is a Phase 2b, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, multiple dose study of PTI-125 in mild-to-moderate Alzheimer's disease patients.
description_detailed: This is a Phase 2b, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, multiple dose study of PTI-125 in mild-to-moderate Alzheimer's disease patients. A total of sixty (60) patients will be enrolled in the study. Patients will receive Placebo, 50 mg or 100 mg b.i.d. of PTI-125. The objective of this study are to investigate the safety, and biomarkers of PTI-125 following 28-day repeat oral administration.

groups.description: Subjects administered placebo oral tablets twice daily (BID)

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measures.title: Mini-Mental State Exam (MMSE)
measures.description: The MMSE is a is a widely used test of cognitive function among the elderly; it includes tests of orientation, attention, memory, language and visual-spatial skills. It is often used to stage Alzheimer's disease. The scale ranges from 0 to 30. No errors = 30.

measures.title: Paired Associates Learning total errors
measures.description: Boxes are displayed on the screen and are "opened" in a randomized order. One or more of them contains a pattern. The patterns are then displayed in the middle of the screen, one at a time and the participant must select the box in which the pattern was originally located. If the participant makes an error, the boxes are opened in sequence again to remind the participant of the locations of the patterns. The number of boxes increases progressively to a total of 8.
measures.populationDescription: The least impaired patients (11 or fewer errors, representing a ceiling effect) and patients with 54 or more errors (very poor performance suggesting not understanding the task) were removed from the analysis. Also removed were the 3 patients with no detectable drug in plasma, 2 patients with ≥25% non-compliance by pill counts, one patient with no baseline test and one who did not understand instructions per rater notes.

measures.title: Spatial Working Memory total errors
measures.description: A number of colored squares (boxes) are shown on the screen. By selecting the boxes and using a process of elimination, the subject should find one yellow 'token' in each of a number of boxes and use them to fill up an empty column on the right-hand side of the screen. The number of boxes is gradually increased to a total of 8 for the subjects to search. The colors and positions of the boxes are changed from trial to trial to discourage stereotyped search strategies.
measures.populationDescription: Removed from analysis were the 3 patients with no detectable drug in plasma, 2 patients with ≥25% non-compliance by pill counts, one patient with no baseline test and one who did not understand instructions per rater notes

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in CSF Abeta42
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from Baseline (screening sample) to Day 28 in cerebrospinal fluid levels of Amyloid beta42
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: As noted in the Participant Flow, one subject in the 50 mg arm did not complete the study. One additional subject in the 50 mg arm was missing a Day 28 CSF sample. This primary analysis includes one 50 mg subject who showed no detectable simufilam in plasma at return visits (their exclusion was not prespecified in the Statistical Analysis Plan).

analyses.groupDescription: This primary analysis includes two 100 mg subjects who showed no detectable simufilam in plasma at return visits (their exclusion was not prespecified in the Statistical Analysis Plan).
analyses.pValueComment: P value adjusted for multiplicity of 6 co-primary endpoints (p\<0.008 required for significance).
analyses.statisticalComment: General Linear Model for the analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) with a two-sided 95% confidence interval and baseline measurement as the covariate.
analyses.otherAnalysisDescription: In a secondary analysis removing two subjects with no detectable simufilam in plasma, P=0.0088 and CFB was 13.4. In percent change from baseline with these two subjects removed, P=0.004.

outcomeMeasures.title: Paired Associates Learning Test
outcomeMeasures.description: Cognitive test assessing episodic memory. Boxes are displayed on the screen and are "opened" in a randomized order. One or more of them contains a pattern. The patterns are then displayed in the middle of the screen, one at a time and the participant must select the box in which the pattern was originally located. If the participant makes an error, the boxes are opened in sequence again to remind the participant of the locations of the patterns. The number of boxes increases progressively to a total of 8.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The least impaired patients (11 or fewer errors, representing a ceiling effect) and patients with 54 or more errors (very poor performance suggesting not understanding the task) were removed from the analysis. Also removed were the 3 patients with no detectable drug in plasma, 2 patients with ≥25% non-compliance by pill counts, one patient with no baseline test and one who did not understand instructions per rater notes.
outcomeMeasures.unitOfMeasure: Change from Day 1 in total errors

outcomeMeasures.title: Spatial Working Memory Test
outcomeMeasures.description: Cognitive assessment of spatial working memory: A number of colored squares (boxes) are shown on the screen. By selecting the boxes and using a process of elimination, the subject should find one yellow 'token' in each of a number of boxes and use them to fill up an empty column on the right-hand side of the screen. The number of boxes is gradually increased to a total of 8 for the subjects to search. The colors and positions of the boxes are changed from trial to trial to discourage stereotyped search strategies.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Removed from analysis were the 3 patients with no detectable drug in plasma, 2 patients with ≥25% non-compliance by pill counts, one patient with no baseline test and one who did not understand instructions per rater notes.
outcomeMeasures.unitOfMeasure: Change from Day 1 in total errors

outcomeMeasures.title: CSF IL-6, sTREM2, HMGB1, Albumin, IgG
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from Baseline (screening sample) to Day 28 in secondary CSF biomarkers of neuroinflammation and blood-brain barrier integrity
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Three subjects who had no detectable simufilam in plasma at return visits were removed from analyses (two in the 100 mg arm and one in the 50 mg arm). As noted in the Participant Flow, one subject in the 50 mg arm did not complete the study. One additional subject in the 50 mg arm was missing a Day 28 CSF sample.
outcomeMeasures.unitOfMeasure: pg/mL; optical density for albumin & IgG

outcomeMeasures.title: Target Engagement Assays: Change From Baseline in Filamin A (FLNA) Linkages to alpha7 Nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor (alpha7nAChR) and Toll-like Receptor 4 (TLR4) in Subject Lymphocytes
outcomeMeasures.description: FLNA linkages to these two receptors were assessed by densitometric quantitation of immunoblot bands of each receptor (detected by a specific antibody) in anti-FLNA precipitates. The measure is noted as a ratio to total FLNA.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Three subjects who had no detectable simufilam in plasma at any return visit were removed from analyses (two in the 100 mg arm and one in the 50 mg arm). As noted in the Participant Flow, one subject in the 50 mg arm did not complete the study. Two additional subjects in the 50 mg arm were missing Day 1 blood samples.

analyses.groupDescription: Change from baseline in FLNA linkage to alpha7nAChR in subject lymphocytes. FLNA linkage to alpha7nAChR was expressed as the ratio of densitometric units of immunoblot bands of alpha7nAChR (probed with a specific antibody) to densitometric units of total FLNA.
analyses.pValueComment: As secondary endpoints, lymphocyte biomarkers were not adjusted for multiplicity.
analyses.statisticalComment: ANOVA was used instead of ANCOVA due to the range in baseline values; it was deemed more appropriate to compare to each subject's own baseline value.

analyses.groupDescription: Change from baseline in FLNA linkage to alpha7nAChR in subject lymphocytes. FLNA linkage to alpha7nAChR was expressed as ratios of densitometric units of immunoblot bands of alpha7nAChR (probed with a specific antibody) to densitometric units of total FLNA.
analyses.pValueComment: As secondary endpoints, lymphocyte biomarkers were not adjusted for multiplicity.
analyses.statisticalComment: ANOVA was used instead of ANCOVA due to the range in baseline values; it was deemed more appropriate to compare to each subject's own baseline value.

analyses.pValueComment: As secondary endpoints, lymphocyte biomarkers were not adjusted for multiplicity.
analyses.statisticalComment: ANOVA was used instead of ANCOVA due to the range in baseline values; it was deemed more appropriate to compare to each subject's own baseline value.

outcomeMeasures.title: Plasma P-tau181
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: For plasma p-tau181 only: 4 subjects (1 in placebo, 2 in 50 mg and 1 in 100 mg arms) were removed because Coefficients of Variation (CVs) between duplicate measurements for either Day 1 or Day 28 samples were \>15% on repeat assay (both Day 1 \& Day 28 for a subject were repeated if CVs of either Day 1 or Day 28 were \>11%). Two outliers were removed (1 in placebo \[1.2 to 4.8 pg/ml\] and 1 in 100 mg \[2.1 to 5.1 pg/ml\] arms) for increases \>150% \& \> 2.5 pg/mL. Missing Day 1 blood samples: 2 in 50 mg.

eventGroups.description: Subjects administered simufilam 50 mg tablets twice daily (BID) for 28 days.

pointOfContact.title: Nadav Friedmann, PhD, MD, Chief Medical Officer

explanation_target: Reason: The investigational agent PTI-125 is a proprietary small molecule that binds an altered conformation of the scaffolding protein filamin A (FLNA), restores its native shape and thereby reduces Aβ42-driven receptor dysfunction, tau hyperphosphorylation and neuroinflammation—actions directed at Alzheimer’s pathology rather than symptomatic cognitive enhancement or behavioral symptom management. citeturn0search3turn0search1

Act: Key extracted details — drug: PTI-125; type: small molecule; molecular target/mechanism: altered filamin A (FLNA) with downstream effects on α7-nAChR and TLR4 signaling, reducing tau phosphorylation and neuroinflammation; trial intent: biomarker and safety evaluation in mild-to-moderate AD (Phase 2b, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multiple-dose). These facts support classification as a disease-targeted small molecule. citeturn0search0turn0search3

Reflect: The classification was verified against primary literature and company reports showing PTI-125’s mechanism and biomarker effects; although later Phase 2 results reporting top-line outcomes have shown mixed/negative primary endpoint findings in some reports, that does not change the mechanism-based category (it remains a small-molecule, pathology-targeted therapeutic). Notable sources: original mechanism study and Phase 2a/2b summaries. citeturn0search3turn0search5turn0search1
explanation_agent: Reason: PTI-125 (simufilam) is a small molecule whose primary molecular target is an altered conformation of the scaffolding protein filamin A (FLNA). By restoring FLNA’s native conformation it prevents Aβ42-driven toxic signaling through α7‑nAChR and TLR4 and thereby reduces tau hyperphosphorylation, Aβ‑related receptor dysfunction, and neuroinflammation — i.e., the drug acts on multiple downstream pathological pathways (amyloid-driven signaling, tau phosphorylation, and inflammation) rather than a single CADRO axis. citeturn0search5turn0search9turn0search4

Act: Key extracted facts from the trial description and literature — drug: PTI‑125 (simufilam); direct molecular target: altered filamin A (a scaffolding/actin‑binding protein); downstream mechanisms/effects: reduces Aβ42–α7nAChR interactions and TLR4 recruitment, lowers phospho‑tau and inflammatory cytokines, and modulates receptor dysfunction and synaptic activity. Because these effects span amyloid‑related signaling, tau pathology and neuroinflammation, the most specific CADRO assignment is R) Multi‑target. citeturn0search2turn0search6

Reflect: This classification was chosen because FLNA itself is not one of the single CADRO categories (e.g., not purely 'Amyloid beta' or 'Tau') and PTI‑125’s mechanism produces measurable effects across multiple CADRO domains (amyloid signaling, tau phosphorylation, inflammation and receptor/synaptic function). Although Phase 2b biomarker/efficacy outcomes have shown mixed or negative top‑line findings (which affect clinical interpretation, not mechanism), that does not change the mechanism‑based CADRO category assignment as multi‑target. citeturn0search3turn0search10

Web search sources used (key results): 1) Original/preclinical mechanism papers showing PTI‑125 binds and reverses altered FLNA and reduces Aβ‑driven tau phosphorylation and neuroinflammation. citeturn0search5turn0search9 2) Phase 2a biomarker study reporting reductions in CSF phospho‑tau, neuroinflammatory markers and other biomarkers after PTI‑125. citeturn0search2 3) Cassava Sciences Phase 2b study announcement and top‑line results (safety reported but primary biomarker endpoint not met in top‑line release). citeturn0search1turn0search3 4) Independent summaries/reviews describing the FLNA/α7‑nAChR/TLR4 mechanism and broad downstream effects. citeturn0search0turn0search4 5) Independent news coverage summarizing Phase 2 findings and variability concerns. citeturn0search10
